data: Basic program for fractals with polynomial functions
Variation of "Default" that shows a map of julia sets.
"Default" with an addend for average coloring methods for polynomial functions
"Default" with a built-in special formula by Mark R Eggleston, called Cczcpaczcp
"Default" with an orbit trap with a transparent pattern
Depictures the minimum and maximum distance to the orbit trap
Program with an aggregator function (fold), also suitable for non-polynomial fractals
"Fold" without bailout for Nova- and Newton fractals
Newton method for root finding fractals
Nova fractal defined by z - R * (z^power + argument) / (z^power + argument)' + p
Secant method for root finding fractals
Magnetic Pendulum Simulation with multiple magnets
Complex function (Color Wheel method by default)
